title: Sun Chariot
credit_line: Gift of C. McKenzie Lewis, Jr.
provenance_text:
Manmohan Samant [1924-2004], New York, NY; Graham Gallery, New York, NY [1]; C. McKenzie Lewis, Jr. [1911-1979], Pittsburgh, PA and Washington, DC, November 1961 until March 28, 1963 [2]; his gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, March 1963 [3]. 

Notes:
[1]. The painting was included (no. 341, illustrated in the catalogue) in "The 1961 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting and Sculpture" held at Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1961 - January 1962. Though the lender in the exhibition catalogue is given as World House Galleries, New York, NY, when the painting was sold payment was made to Graham Gallery (see note [2] below.)
[2]. The painting was purchased from the International by C. McKenzie Lewis, Jr. for $1,750. Payment to Graham Gallery was sent on November 22, 1961; receipt of payment was acknowledged by the gallery on November 24, 1961.
[3]. The painting was on loan to Carnegie Institute from the time of its purchase by Mr. Lewis until it was accessioned on March 28, 1963.
